newsitem.title: CHINA: China PC sales seen up 60 pct in 1997.
newsitem.headline: China PC sales seen up 60 pct in 1997.

text.p: Sales of personal computers in China are seen hitting 40 billion yuan ($4.8 billion) in 1997, with the number of units sold soaring 60 percent from this year, the China Securities said on Monday.
The newspaper did not give an estimate for the value of personal computer (PC) sales this year but said the volume would reach 1.6 million sets, up 40 percent from last year.
It quoted the Ministry of Electronics Industry as estimating the total rising to 2.4-2.7 million units next year.
About 20 percent of the PCs sold this year were for home use and the market for home computers was seen growing by 50 percent in 1997, the ministry said.
In some more developed coastal cities, about five households out of every 100 owned a computer, the ministry said.
Demand for computers in many industries would also see a big rise next year, it said but did not elaborate.
PCs fitted with Pentium chips would capture 80 percent of the market, it said without giving further details.
